page.title: 06HISTORY CONTINUED
page.content: Clanranald imprisoned his wife to prevent her running away with a lover. In some versions of the story he rescued her and in others she died there. The remains of a dam above the old mill are still clearly visible and the old stones are lying outside. The mill has since been used as a smithy but is now just a store. There are remains of dwellings, wells and querns at the sites of the old settlements all over the island.These ruins and the evidence of the lazy beds and runrigs which still mould the landscape are constant reminders of the island's past and previous larger population. Much of this history is kept alive in the oral tradition of the island.
